Event.0: Australian novelist Colleen McCullough, best known for her sweeping romance The Thorn Birds (1977) and for the Masters of Rome series (1990–2007), died at age 77.
Event.1: Author Janet Frame, who created a unique body of work that presents perhaps the most-recognized voice of New Zealand outside her native country, died.
Event.2: US President George W. Bush in his State of the Union address describes "regimes that sponsor terror" an "Axis of Evil", which includes Iraq, Iran and North Korea
Event.3:
Iraq, Iran, and North Korea called an “axis of evil”
On this day in 2002, U.S. President George W. Bush, delivering a State of the Union address, described Iraq, Iran, and North Korea as an “axis of evil” for their attempts to develop nuclear, chemical, or biological weaponry.
Event.4: 6,138th performance of "Cats" is held in London, surpassing record of Broadway's longest-running musical, "A Chorus Line"
Event.5: Actor Michael Keaton (38) divorces actress Caroline McWilliams (44) after 7 years of marriage
Event.6: Lisa files for separation from husband NY Met Darryl Strawberry
Event.7:
Paul Ryan
American politician
was born
Event.8: Brazilian football (soccer) player Romário, who was one of the most prolific goal scorers in the sport's history, was born in Rio de Janeiro.
Event.9: "Dr Strangelove", directed by Stanley Kubrick and starring Peter Sellers and George C. Scott, premieres
Event.10: Actress Elizabeth Taylor's 1st divorce from hotel heir Conrad Hilton Jr
Event.11:
Germaine Greer
Australian writer
was born
Event.12: Babe Ruth and Ty Cobb were among the first players to be elected to the Baseball Hall of Fame in Cooperstown, New York.
Event.13: 1st players elected to Baseball Hall of Fame: Ty Cobb, Babe Ruth, Honus Wagner, Christy Mathewson & Walter Johnson
Event.14: The first machine for rolling ice cream cones was patented by Carl Rutherford Taylor of Cleveland, Ohio.
Event.15: President of Turkey Mustafa Kemal Ataturk (41) weds highly-educated woman Latife Hanim
Event.16: The Prohibition (Eighteenth) Amendment to the U.S. Constitution was ratified and went into effect the following year.
Event.17: Sculptor Auguste Rodin (76) weds Rose Beuret
Event.18: The American League of Professional Baseball Clubs was organized in Philadelphia.
Event.19: Emile Grubbe is the first doctor to use radiation treatment for breast cancer
Event.20: The Coca-Cola Company is incorporated in Atlanta, Georgia
Event.21: German mechanical engineer Karl Benz patented the first practical automobile powered by an internal-combustion engine.
Event.22: Karl Benz patents the "Benz Patent-Motorwagen" in Karlsruhe, Germany, the world's 1st automobile with a burning motor
Event.23: American actor and comedian W.C. Fields was born in Philadelphia.
Event.24: Russian author Anton Chekhov—who was known for his plays and short stories, which often lacked complex plots and neat solutions—was born.
Event.25:
Anton Chekhov
Russian author
was born
Event.26: American author Edgar Allan Poe's The Raven was first published, appearing in the New York Mirror; a melancholy evocation of lost love, it became one of the best-known poems in American literature.
Event.27:
William McKinley
president of United States
was born
Event.28: English naturalist and "On the Origin of Species" author Charles Darwin (42) marries Emma Wedgwood (41)
Event.29: British East India Company administrator Sir Stamford Raffles established the port of Singapore.
Event.30:
Thomas Paine
British-American author
was born
Event.31: William Shakespeare's play "Romeo and Juliet" is thought to have been first performed. Officially published early 1597.
